content:
A $40 gift card to a local nursery or gardening store is a wonderful idea! The amount is generous enough to allow your neighbor to purchase a nice item or a few smaller ones, but not so much that it feels overwhelming.

With $40, your neighbor could buy:

* A few bags of high-quality potting soil or mulch
* A set of gardening tools, like a trowel, pruners, and gloves
* A small potted plant or a bouquet of fresh flowers
* A decorative garden stone or a small statue

If you want to consider spending a bit more, a $50 or $60 gift card would give your neighbor even more flexibility to choose something they really want or need. They might be able to purchase:

* A larger or more exotic plant, like an orchid or a succulent arrangement
* A gardening book or a magazine subscription
* A set of gardening gloves and a water-resistant apron
* A garden decoration, like a sundial or a birdbath

Ultimately, the amount you choose depends on your budget and your relationship with your neighbor. If you want to show your appreciation without breaking the bank, $40 is a great starting point. If you want to make an even bigger impact, consider spending a bit more.

Remember to include a heartfelt note or card with the gift card, expressing your gratitude for your neighbor's help and thoughtfulness. That will make the gift even more special and meaningful!
